Void the payment for an order updating the payment_status to void pending.

store_v2_orders

blocks.data:
Void the payment for an order updating the `payment_status` to `void pending`.

Requires at least one of the following scopes:
* `store_v2_orders`
* `store_v2_transactions`

### OAuth Scopes
|  **UI Name** | **Permission** | **Parameter** |
| --- | --- | --- |
|  Order Transactions | read and modify `transactions` and `payment_methods` | `store_v2_transactions` |
|  Order Transactions | read `transactions` and `payment_methods`  | `store_v2_transactions_read_only` |
|  Orders | read and modify `payment_methods` |`store_v2_orders`|
|  Orders | read `payment_methods` |`store_v2_orders_read_only`|

### Headers

|Header|Parameter|Description|
|-|-|-|
|`X-Auth-Token`|`access_token `|Obtained by creating an API account or installing an app in a BigCommerce control panel.|

### Example

```http
GET /stores/{$$.env.store_hash}/v3/catalog/summary
host: api.bigcommerce.com
Content-Type: application/json
X-Auth-Token: {access_token}
```

* For more information on Authenticating BigCommerce APIs, see: [Authentication](https://developer.bigcommerce.com/api-docs/getting-started/authentication).
* **Name**: X-Auth-Token
* **Location**: header

Malformed request syntax. Typically need to fix the JSON
Body to resend successfully.

blocks.data: If this occurs, you should retry the request. Typically retrying the request several times will result in a successful request; However, if you are unable to successfully make a request, please check the BigCommerce system status [here](https://status.bigcommerce.com/). A service is likely down and the request will need to be made again when it is back up (in several hours usually)
